Issues.Title: Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer
Issues.Body:
# Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer As a proof of concept I am trying to build a simple WPF, C#, .Net Core 3.0 application, using Xaml Islands NuGet packages (Microsoft.Windows.SDK.Contracts and Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost) and "Windows Application Packaging Project C#". When I add the following two lines to MainWindow.xaml: xmlns:
XamlHost="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost;
assembly=Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost" x:Name="xamlHost"
InitialTypeName="Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Button"
ChildChanged="WindowsXamlHost_ChildChanged"/>

## Error "XamlHost:WindowsXamlHost" has a blue line under it with the following error:
"Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer".

## Research I did some research on GitHub and I found this file for WinForms [here](https://github.com/windows-toolkit/Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32/blob/master/Microsoft.Toolkit.Forms.UI.XamlHost/WindowsXamlHostBase.cs)

Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32/Microsoft.Toolkit.Forms.UI.XamlHost/WindowsXamlHostBase.cs
namespace Microsoft.Toolkit.Forms.UI.XamlHost
public abstract partial class WindowsXamlHostBase : ContainerControl
private static readonly IXamlMetadataContainer _metadataContainer;

>THIS FILE DOES NOT EXIST FOR WPF!
## Sofware used to build the application:
  • Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2019 Preview (version 16.2.0 Preview 2.0).
  • Windows 10 Pro 1903 OS Build 18362.10005
  • Target Framework .Net Core 3.0
  • Windows Application Packaging
    • Target version: Windows 10. version 1903 (10.0; Build 18362)
    • Min version: Windows 10. version 1903 (10.0; Build 18362)
  • NuGet Packages
    • Microsoft.Windows.SDK.Contracts
    • Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost

Here is the remainder of the code, but the error occurs before I can build the project.  Also note that I got this to work without an issue using the WPF, C#, .Net Framework 4.7.2.  I manually loaded the contracts from my PC and used the stable versions of the NuGet Package: Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost.

MainWindow.xaml.cs
using Microsoft.Toolkit.Wpf.UI.XamlHost;
private void WindowsXamlHost_ChildChanged(object sender, System.EventArgs e)
{ WindowsXamlHost windowsXamlHost = (WindowsXamlHost)sender; Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Button button = (Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Button)windowsXamlHost.Child; if (button == null) //When the window is closed, this method will be executed again. return; button.Content = "My UWP button"; button.Click += Button_Click; }

private void Button_Click(object sender, Windows.UI.Xaml.RoutedEventArgs e)
{
MessageBox.Show("My UWP button works");
}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Could not find Windows Runtime type Microsoft.Toolkit.Win32.UI.XamlHost.IXamlMetadataContainer" (#1290)

Issues.Title: fixing DrtXpsApi failures
Issues.Body:
Fixes failures in DrtXpsApi as outlined in #1054

The implementation in CoreFx is more strict on ensuring that callers properly close streams before they are re-opened in update mode. this prevents multiple different streams from being updated at the same time since it uncompresses the data and stores it in memory

The callstacks we get is this:
```
>	System.IO.Compression.dll!System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveEntry.OpenInUpdateMode() Line 700	C#
 	System.IO.Compression.dll!System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveEntry.Open() Line 299	C#
 	System.IO.Packaging.dll!System.IO.Packaging.ZipStreamManager.Open(System.IO.Compression.ZipArchiveEntry zipArchiveEntry, System.IO.FileMode streamFileMode, System.IO.FileAccess streamFileAccess)	Unknown
 	System.IO.Packaging.dll!System.IO.Packaging.ZipPackagePart.GetStreamCore(System.IO.FileMode streamFileMode, System.IO.FileAccess streamFileAccess)	Unknown
 	System.IO.Packaging.dll!System.IO.Packaging.PackagePart.GetStream(System.IO.FileMode mode, System.IO.FileAccess access)	Unknown
 	ReachFramework.dll!System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.IsSignable.get()	Unknown
 	ReachFramework.dll!System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate certificate, bool embedCertificate, System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigSigPartAlteringRestrictions restrictions, string signatureId, bool testIsSignable)	Unknown
 	ReachFramework.dll!System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.SignDigitally(System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate certificate, bool embedCertificate, System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDigSigPartAlteringRestrictions restrictions)	Unknown
 	DRTXpsApi.dll!DRT.DigSignVerifyTestSuite.SignPackage() Line 1244	C#
 	DRTXpsApi.dll!DRT.DrtBase.RunNextTest() Line 2060	C#
 	DRTXpsApi.dll!DRT.DrtBase.RunNextTestOperation(object arg) Line 2004	C#
```

Here is the code that throws the exception in CoreFx:
https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/System.IO.Compression/src/System/IO/Compression/ZipArchiveEntry.cs#L697
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fixing DrtXpsApi failures" (#1301)

Issues.Title: Updated GetHashCode for MILColorF structs
Issues.Body:
Issue #848 

In CoreCLR, the GetHashCode logic for the MILColorF struct (struct with float values) changed and only uses the first field for hash computation (see [this](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/35613) for more details). Added custom GetHashCode logic to the MILColorF struct in order to have the GetHashCode computation use all four float values for hash computation (as per recommendation from [here](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/35613#issuecomment-467726210)).
Opened a [complementary PR in the internal repo](https://dnceng.visualstudio.com/internal/_git/dotnet-wpf-int/pullrequest/2196?_a=overview) to update the MILColorF struct definitions there as well.

- Verified that the failing 2D color test is now passing.
- Ran a full DRT test pass and verified that DRTs are at baseline.
- Logged a new issue for the updating of other structs in the codebase that are affected by the same change [here](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1307).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Updated GetHashCode for MILColorF structs" (#1308)

Issues.Title: Update WPF structs to compute more inclusive hashes
Issues.Body:
In CoreCLR, the GetHashCode logic for structs with float/double parameters has changed and now only uses the first field for hash computation (see [this](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/35613) for more details).
As [recommended](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/35613#issuecomment-467726210), we should go through these structs to override and implement our own hashes. These new hashes should be more inclusive in order to better mirror what the behaviour was like in .NET Framework. There is already an example of this being done [here](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1308) for the MILColorF struct.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Update WPF structs to compute more inclusive hashes" (#1307)

Issues.Title: Default to 'true' for unset properties owned by WPF
Issues.Body:
Default to 'true' for unset `EnableDefaultPageItems` and `EnableDefaultApplicationDefinition` in `Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop.props` to allow MSBuild's `CheckForDuplicateItems` to provide a descriptive duplicate `Page` error.  The check was previously no-op'd in the target due to unset properties.  

Builds with duplicate `Page` items now fail with this error: 

C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview8-013270\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop.targets(21,5): error NETSDK1022: Duplicate 'Page' items were included. The .NET SDK includes 'Page' items from your project directory by default. You can either remove these items from your project file, or set the 'EnableDefaultPageItems' property to 'false' if you want to explicitly include them in your project file. For more information, see https://aka.ms/sdkimplicititems. The duplicate items were: 'Themes\Generic.xaml' [I:\test\XSecControls\XSecControls.csproj]

Provides a better error message for #1264.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Default to 'true' for unset properties owned by WPF" (#1300)

Issues.Title: Update documentation for Default Items
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1264#issuecomment-512579451

> https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/csproj#default-compilation-includes-in-net-core-projects needs to be updated.

https://aka.ms/sdkimplicititems should be updated with information about `EnableDefaultPageItems` and `EnableDefaultApplicationDefinition` 

Also see https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1300

/cc @grubioe

Issues.Title: add wpf class library template
Issues.Body: fixes #1297
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "add wpf class library template" (#1298)

Issues.Title: Support Class Library project templates
Issues.Body:
This is to bring us to experience parity with desktop for WPF on .NET Core 3.0.

On desktop today you can add a class library project to your existing WPF solution and everything will just work. Due to complexities in how Framework References work this will not light up automatically.  Instead we will need a WPF Class library template that has the correct framework references.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support Class Library project templates" (#1297)

Issues.Title: Need a way to suppress CS8614 in dev builds
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/issues/37281 for context 

After upgrading to Dev16.2.0 Preview 4 builds, local builds would start failing with CS8614 at [dotnet/wpf:SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/ae1790531c3b993b56eba8b1f0dd395a3ed7de75/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/WindowsBase/System/ComponentModel/SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138)

In order to continue building successfully (until the roslyn/corefx issue is resolved), we need to set `NoWarn=8614`. This can not be supplied from `msbuild` commandline durectly via `/p:NoWarn=8614` because doing so will override the `<NoWarn>...</NoWarn>` settings already specifified in project files. 

We need a way to specify an additional warning-filter in the commandline for diagnostics/dev builds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need a way to suppress CS8614 in dev builds" (#1289)

Issues.Title: `AdditionalNoWarn` support for diagnostic builds/debugging/dev-builds
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/issues/37281 for context 

After upgrading to Dev16.2.0 Preview 4 builds, local builds would start failing with CS8614 at [dotnet/wpf:SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/ae1790531c3b993b56eba8b1f0dd395a3ed7de75/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/WindowsBase/System/ComponentModel/SortDescriptionCollection.cs#L138)

. In order to continue building successfully (until the roslyn/corefx issue is resolved), we need to supply `/p:AdditionalNoWarn:8614` 

Fixes #1289
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "`AdditionalNoWarn` support for diagnostic builds/debugging/dev-builds" (#1288)

Issues.Title: Remove support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode`
Issues.Body:
Remove support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode` and permanently disallow deserialization of dangerous types.

- Removes support for AppContext flag `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode`
- Permanently limits clipboard-deserialziation to primitive non-text types only.

Fixes #1132

PS: Creating a WIP PR since this hasn't gone through enough testing yet.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove support for `UseLegacyDangerousClipboardDeserializationMode`" (#1286)

Issues.Title: Update localized strings that render \r\n as text
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**
When you use an Open File Dialog and provide an invalid file OR if you use a Save File Dialog and try to overwrite an existing file the messagebox renders the \r\n as text instead of  a line break.

See issue #977 for a full description. 

Confirmed these updates fix File Dialog messages in English and German.  (Fixes #977.)
